body_content.explanation: a ship with hidden weapons that is made to look like a merchant ship (= one used for trading rather than for military purposes) in order to trick the enemy :
examples: The idea of the Q-boat was to pretend it was a harmless, helpless merchant ship.
She uses a wide range of primary and secondary source material to tell the compelling story of the Q-ships.
He was one of the first officers selected for Q-ship service in 1915.
